title: Ping spikes
body:
Has anyone been having spikes in ping recently on NA? Over the last two days I've had my regular 35~40 but in some games it has spiked over 150 and at the highest 400. I haven't found anyone with a similar issue. In another MMO I played recently I had the same issue and so did others but only those under the same ISP.

I live in NY and my ISP is Time Warner (rip). Wondering if it's just me or mainly those under the same ISP. Thanks in advance for any help.

replies.body:
I can explain the ping issues, and you may not like to hear it.

Due to the "election rampage" taking place, the North-East has been experiencing high traffic and extremely variable connection speeds.
This also has to do with a lot of people utilizing the network through various forms.

So, let me put it this way...
Time between hops, Benchmarks, and IB/OB data transfer will be slower than normal.
Do you have P2P enabled?  I have noticed my ping SKYROCKET when I leave this enabled...and I live in Michigan, using comcast.  Without it enabled, my ping remains at 12ms - 38ms.
Enabled, my ping is highly variable from 32ms up to 200ms.

Might I also suggest you look into giving priority to Leagues connection through your modem as well via PRF and PRT...and if the option is available to you, QoS and give your system highest priority.

By the way...some of the TW modems are garbage...especially the telephony modems.

Haven't seen anything reported on widespread NY and/or TWC issues lately.  If it's happening in multiple games/applications though it sounds like it could unfortunately be a local ISP issue.  Just to help rule out the most common network errors though, I'd recommend checking out our [Log Reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743).  Can read your network log and provide some tips for fixing any issues it recognizes.
